''' Retail Intelligence''' is the set of tools and applications focused on the creation and [[Knowledge management|management of knowledge]] through the recollection, processing, interaction and analysis of information generated in all operations performed by any retailer.
Retail Intelligence applications can relate in real time and interactively, the internal variables (range, space, pricing, promotions, staff, sales) with the [[external variable]]s (influence zone and its commercial mix), with different parameters of the shopper's behavior, such as [[pedestrian]] flows and magnitudes, length of stay, occupancy, hot spots, etc.
These applications provide users with a greater understanding of the current functioning of the points of sale and the [[buyer behaviour]] (shopper), to anticipate future events, with the aim of improving the competitive position of its portfolio of stores increasing [[Profit (economics)|profitability]], efficiency commercial and [[customer service]], and identify new business opportunities.
==Operation==
Retail Intelligence tools combine the technology hardware (readers of traffic, [[people counter]]s, [[motion sensor]]s) with [[management software]] used for data access tools and provide reports, analysis, views and alerts to users.
==Tools== Retail Intelligence includes the following tools: * External Traffic reader: sensor that allows external counting. * In&Out traffic counter: sensors that count in&out traffic at points of sale, allowing to separate the inputs and outputs as well as gauging and measuring the average time of stay. * Motion sensors: sensors that enable the flow behavior of customers, distinguishing the hottest areas from the least visited at each point of sale. Access to information is done interactively, via [[intranet]] and through tiered access, providing reporting, analysis, views and alerts to users.
==References== {{reflist}} *Medina Soto, Jorge Alfredo (2005), [http://www.gestiopolis.com/recursos5/docs/ger/buconce.htm Business Intelligence: conceptos y actualidad] *Jay Lindquist and Joseph Sirgy (2008), Shopper, Buyer, And Consumer Behavior: Theory, Marketing Applications, And Public Policy * T-Cuento (2010) [http://www.t-cuento.com/eng/news.php?x=Pedestrian+traffic%2C+a+key+tool+for+Retail Pedestrian Traffic, a key tool for Retail] * Distribución Actualidad (2010), [http://www.distribucionactualidad.com/noticia/9366/Mercados/tecnolog%C3%ADas-informaci%C3%B3n-punto-venta.html Tecnologías de la Información en el Punto de Venta]

{{EngvarB|date=April 2015}} {{Use dmy dates|date=April 2015}} {{Infobox person | name = Ricky Wong | image = Ricky_profile.jpg | image_size = 220px | caption = | birth_name = Wong Shee Kai | birth_place = {{Birth date and age|df=yes|1981|12|12}}
[[Kuala Lumpur]], [[Malaysia]] | nationality = Malaysian | alma_mater = [[Lancaster University]] | occupation = CEO, [[Asia Media]] | website ={{url|asiamedia.net.my}} | footnotes = }} [[Malay titles#Dato.27|Dato']] '''Ricky Wong Shee Kai''' (born 12 December 1981 in [[Kuala Lumpur]]) is a [[Malaysia]]n investor, entrepreneur and philanthropist. He is the CEO and [[Entrepreneur|founder]] of [[Asia Media]], Malaysia's largest Transit-TV network operator,{{cite web |url=http://www.adoimagazine.com/newhome/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=4915:asia-media-announces-plan-to-start-live-digital-broadcast&catid=1:breaking-news&Itemid=5 |title=Asia Media Announces Plan to Start Live Digital Broadcast |accessdate=23 November 2009 |date=30 April 2009 |publisher=''[[Adoi Magazine]]'' |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20091112044917/http://www.adoimagazine.com/newhome/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=4915%3Aasia-media-announces-plan-to-start-live-digital-broadcast&catid=1%3Abreaking-news&Itemid=5# |archive-date=12 November 2009 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }} three-time winner of the [[Junior Chamber International#JCI CYEA|JCI – Creative Young Entrepreneur Award]].{{cite web |url=http://www.dailyexpress.com.my/news.cfm?NewsID=67682 |title=Asia Media expects 20pc revenue growth |accessdate=23 November 2009 |date=30 April 2009 |publisher=''[[Daily Express (Sabah)|Daily Express]]'' |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110621231959/http://www.dailyexpress.com.my/news.cfm?NewsID=67682 |archivedate=21 June 2011 |df=dmy-all }} He was honoured as a [[Young Global Leader]] by the [[World Economic Forum]], Davos in 2014. ==Biography== Wong attended [[Chong Hwa Independent High School, Kuala Lumpur]]. He obtained a [[Bachelor of Arts]] in Accounting and Finance from [[Lancaster University Management School]]. Wong practised accounting briefly in the United Kingdom before returning to Malaysia where he joined a manufacturing company. ===Asia Media=== Wong founded [[Asia Media]] in 2007. Under his leadership, Asia Media has grown into a media company that reaches over 1.24 million viewers daily. The company also owns and operates the largest Transit-TV network in [[Malaysia]] known as [[Asia Media]] TV (AMTV).{{cite web |url=http://biz.thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=/2009/4/13/business/3675529&sec=business|title= A joyful ride in media business for Wong|accessdate=23 November 2009 |date=13 April 2009 |publisher=''[[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]]'' }} Asia Media was the first Malaysian company to be awarded 10-year licenses to operate three (3) blocks of [[L band#DAB L band usage|L-Band Spectrums]] for both fixed and mobile broadcasting. The licenses cover both free and paid broadcasting models. The company opted for [[Digital Terrestrial Multimedia Broadcast|DMB-T]] technology for its mobile TV application.{{cite web |url=http://www.rwonline.com/article/101588|title= Asia Media Plans L-Band T-DMB Network|accessdate=14 June 2010 |date=14 June 2010 |publisher=''[[Radio World]]'' }} ===Bright Packaging=== On 10 February 2014, non-executive director Datuk Seri Syed Ali Alhabshee has ceased to be a substantial shareholder of the company following the disposal of his entire shareholding in a direct business transaction to Wong. Wong currently holds a 32.81% stake in Bright Packaging.{{cite web |url=http://www.thestar.com.my/Business/Business-News/2014/02/11/Ali-Abbas-sells-entire-stake|title= Ali Abbas sells entire stake|accessdate=12 February 2014 |date=12 February 2014 |publisher=''[[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]]'' }} In October 2013, Wong emerged as a dominant shareholder in [[Bright Packaging Industry]] Berhad, a main board listed company on [[Bursa Malaysia]].{{cite web |url=http://www.btimes.com.my/articles/20131011002423/Article/ |title=Wong is major shareholder of Bright Packaging |accessdate=14 October 2013 |date=14 October 2013 |publisher=''[[Business Times (Kuala Lumpur)|Business Times]]'' |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131016101334/http://www.btimes.com.my/articles/20131011002423/Article/# |archive-date=16 October 2013 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }} This is the second public-listed company in which the 31-year-old Wong has a controlling stake after [[Asia Media]].{{cite web |url=http://www.thestar.com.my/Business/Business-News/2013/10/10/Wong-Shee-Kai-emerges-in-Bright-Packaging.aspx|title= Wong Shee Kai emerges in Bright Packaging with 22.7% stake|accessdate=14 October 2013 |date=14 October 2013 |publisher=''[[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]]'' }} Wong acquired a 22.73% equity stake in the packaging company which also owns two freehold sites with a combined area of 136,998 square feet in Prime Klang valley's Subang Hi-Tech Industrial Park where its headquarters and factories are located. As of 31 August 2013, debt-free Bright Packaging had cash of $19.94 million while net assets per share stood at 62 cents.{{cite web |url=http://www.theedgemalaysia.com/highlights/227950-hot-stocks-bright-packaging-hits-10-yr-high-on-potential-board-change.html |title=Hot Stock: Bright Packaging soars 17% on rights issue, free warrants |accessdate=16 October 2013 |date=16 October 2013 |publisher=''[[The Edge (Malaysia)|The Edge]]'' |archive-url=https://archive.is/20131014160556/http://www.theedgemalaysia.com/highlights/227950-hot-stocks-bright-packaging-hits-10-yr-high-on-potential-board-change.html# |archive-date=14 October 2013 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }} The market reacted positively after news of Wong's investment was made public and the stock increased another 17% on news of its expansion plan through rights issue.{{cite web |url=http://www.theedgemalaysia.com/highlights/258741-hot-stock-bright-packaging-soars-17-on-rights-issue-free-warrants.html |title=Bright Packaging hits 10-yr high on potential board change |accessdate=16 October 2013 |date=16 October 2013 |publisher=''[[The Edge (Malaysia)|The Edge]]'' |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131016224355/http://www.theedgemalaysia.com/highlights/258741-hot-stock-bright-packaging-soars-17-on-rights-issue-free-warrants.html# |archive-date=16 October 2013 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }} News of Wong's interest in taking the company private were denied by the Board in its annual general meeting held on 24 February 2014. Wong has quietly built up his stake in the company and currently holds 32.81% which is just short of the 33% threshold required to trigger a mandatory general offer.[http://www.thesundaily.my/news/967420 "MGO for Bright Packaging unlikely"]. ''TheSunDaily'', 25 February 2014. ===Techfast Holdings=== In May 2014, Wong made an offer of to acquire Techfast Holdings. The offer was submitted on the same day that Techfast held its AGM raising speculation that the offer may turn hostile. Wong had previously built a 14.45% stake in the company. TechFast noted its listing status is expected to be maintained should Wong's offer be accepted.[http://www.therakyatpost.com/business/2014/05/16/ricky-wong-launches-takeover-techfast/ "Ricky Wong launches takeover of TechFast"]. ''RakyatPost'', 16 February 2014. This offer has been perceived as a takeover, an attempt by Wong to control three public-listed companies.[http://www.theborneopost.com/2014/05/17/techfast-gets-takeover-notice-at-26-sen-per-share/ "Techfast gets takeover notice at 26 cents per share"]. ''BorneoPost'', 17 May 2014.[http://www.nama.com.my/PRINT_NEWS/2014/06/17/20140617_N60_RSV_CR_2_BW_OFFER~FOR~TECHFAST~IS~FAIR~AND~REASONABLE.JPG "Offer for Techfast is Fair and Reasonable"] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140714144840/http://www.nama.com.my/PRINT_NEWS/2014/06/17/20140617_N60_RSV_CR_2_BW_OFFER~FOR~TECHFAST~IS~FAIR~AND~REASONABLE.JPG |date=14 July 2014 }}. ''MalaysianReserve'', 17 June 2014. Techfast Holdings's conditional voluntary takeover offer by Wong to acquire all the remaining shares in the company could only gather 22.48% of the share capital in Techfast with the offer tabled. The offer failed to meet the acceptance conditions within the proposed timeline.[http://www.nama.com.my/PRINT_NEWS/2014/06/30/20140630_N60_RSV_CR_2_BW_WONG~SKS~TAKEOVER~OFFER~FOR~TECHFAST~FAILS.JPG "Wong SK's Takeover Offer for Techfast Fails "] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140714144652/http://www.nama.com.my/PRINT_NEWS/2014/06/30/20140630_N60_RSV_CR_2_BW_WONG~SKS~TAKEOVER~OFFER~FOR~TECHFAST~FAILS.JPG |date=14 July 2014 }}. ''MalaysianReserve'', 28 June 2014. Since the failed takeover by Wong in May 2014, Wong through his personal investment company Wong SK Holdings Sdn Bhd, has quietly emerged as the second largest shareholder of Techfast Holdings bearing 24,518,700 shares which equivalent to 16% of the share capital. According to its Annual Report 2014, the largest shareholder is AVB Ventures Sdn Bhd which is controlled by its Managing Director Mr. Yap Yoon Seng, bearing 18.42% of its share capital. It remain to be seen that Wong emergence as the second largest shareholder of Techfast Holdings will again turn hostile to the incumbent Board of Directors.{{cite web |url=http://www.bursamalaysia.com/market/listed-companies/company-announcements/4719553|title=Annual Report TECHFAST HOLDINGS BERHAD|accessdate=13 August 2015 |date=28 April 2015 |publisher=''[[Bursa Malaysia]]'' }}{{cite web |url=http://www.bursamalaysia.com/market/listed-companies/company-announcements/4825885|title=Changes in Sub. S-hldr's Int. (29B) TECHFAST HOLDINGS BERHAD|accessdate=13 August 2015 |date=12 August 2015 |publisher=''[[Bursa Malaysia]]'' }} ===Young Global Leader=== On 11 March 2014, Wong was the only Malaysian honoured by the [[World Economic Forum]] as a [[Young Global Leader]] this year. This honour is bestowed by the World Economic Forum each year to recognise leaders who, amongst others, have achieved their success under the age of forty (40) and have track record of substantial leadership experience. Wong and 213 other honourees who were nominated from around the world, join the ranks of some of the most accomplished business and political leaders.{{cite web |url=http://widgets.weforum.org/ygl-2014|title=Young Global Leaders Class of 2014|accessdate=12 March 2014 |date=12 March 2014 |publisher=''[[Young Global Leader]]'' }}{{cite web |url=http://www.asiamedia.net.my/sites/default/files/Press%20Release%20-%20YGL%2011%20March%202014.pdf |title=Dato' Ricky Wong Honoured as a 2014 Young Global Leader by World Economic Forum |accessdate=13 March 2014 |date=13 March 2014 |publisher=''Asia Media Sdn Bhd'' }}{{Dead link|date=November 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}{{cite web |url=http://www.weforum.org/content/pages/nominate-young-global-leader|title=Nominate a Young Global Leader |accessdate=5 June 2014 |date=5 June 2014 |publisher=''[[Young Global Leader]]'' }} ===Junior Chamber International=== Wong is a three-time winner of the Malaysia's [[Junior Chamber International#JCI CYEA|Junior Chamber International's Creative Young Entrepreneur Award]] from 2008 till 2010 which is designed specifically to recognise and honour exceptionally creative young entrepreneurs for their success. [[Junior Chamber International#JCI CYEA|JCI]] is a worldwide federation of young professionals and entrepreneurs between the ages of eighteen (18) to forty (40) with representatives from more than one hundred (100) nations.{{cite web |url=http://www.jcicyea.com.my/|title= Creative Young Entrepreneur Award|accessdate=5 June 2014 |date=5 June 2014 |publisher=''[[Junior Chamber International]]'' }} ==Awards== ===2014=== In the 16 November 2014 issue of Malaysian Business magazine, Wong appeared in the "30 Successful Under-40 Malaysians" list. He stood out for the successes he have carved out in the media industry which he replicated across different industries as an investor.{{cite web|url=http://www.asiamedia.net.my/sites/default/files/Malaysian%20Business%20161114.pdf|title=30 Successful Under-40 Malaysians|accessdate=26 November 2014|date=16 November 2014|publisher=Malaysian Business''}}{{Dead link|date=November 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} In the 30 August 2014 issue of ''Focus Malaysia Weekly'', Wong appeared in the "20 Rich and Young" list. Wong's holdings in public companies is estimated to be worth some $56.8 million from his stakes in Asia Media, Bright Packaging Industry Bhd and Techfast Holdings Bhd.{{cite web |url=https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.10152403066772981.1073741827.779857980&type=1&l=fa998da24b|title=20 Rich and Young|accessdate=29 September 2014 |date=30 August 2014 |publisher=''Facebook''}} ===2013=== In the 30 March 2013 issue of ''Focus Malaysia Weekly'', Wong appeared in the "40 CEOs under 40" list. Wong is the youngest CEO of a Bursa-listed company and [[Asia Media]] is the first company in Malaysian corporate history to have grown organically from a self-funded startup into a company listed on the Main Board of Bursa Malaysia. In February 2013, Wong was listed in the Top 10 ACE Market millionaires by Malaysian Business magazine for the third year in a row. ===2012=== In February 2012, Wong, was listed in the Top 10 ACE Market millionaires list by Malaysian Business magazine in its February 2012 issue. ===2011=== In February 2011, Wong was listed in the Top 10 ACE Market millionaires list by Malaysian Business magazine in its February 2011 issue.{{cite web |url=http://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_qn6207/is_20110216/ai_n56942662/pg_2/?tag=content;col1|title=Top 10 ACE Market Millionaires|accessdate=17 March 2011 |date=16 February 2011 |publisher=Malaysian Business'' }} Also in the same month, Wong was featured as the winner in Prestige magazine's 'PRESTIGE 2010s Top 40 Under 40' award. On 11 January 2011, a date deliberately chosen as an auspicious day according to Chinese culture, Wong led Asia Media Group to a strong debut on the ACE Market opening at 40 sen, up 74% from its offer price of 23 sen. Subsequently, it closed at 28.5 sen, up 24% from its offer price with 40.92 million shares done.{{cite web |url=http://www.theedgemalaysia.com/business/179961-asia-media-surges-on-debut.html {{Orphan|date=September 2015}} {{Infobox person | name = Robert Geiss | image = Robert Geiss Poldi Benefitzspiel.jpg | image_size = x300px | caption = Robert Geiss playing soccer at a benefit match. | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1964|01|29}} | birth_place = [[Cologne]] | residence = [[Monaco]], [[St. Tropez]], [[Miami]] | nationality = [[Germany|German]] | occupation = [[Businessman]] | years_active = 1986–present | known_for = Fitness clothing, designing, business ambition, TV | notable_works = Uncle Sam, Roberto Geissini, [[Die Geissens – Eine schrecklich glamouröse Familie|Die Geissens]] | salary = [[Euro|€]]2–6 million (2015) | net_worth = {{Loss}} €2.5 million (2015){{cite news|title=Vermögen und Verdienst der Geissens im Jahr 2015|language=German|url=http://www.luxusleben.info/die-geissens-vermoegen/|accessdate=10 April 2015}} | television = Die Geissens | spouse = [[Carmen Geiss]]
(married 1994–present) | children = Davina Shakira Geiss
Shania Tyra Maria Geiss| parents = Reinhold Geiss (father)
Margret Geiss (mother) | relatives = Martina Geiss (sister)
Michael Geiss (brother) | awards = [[Deutscher Fernsehpreis]] (nominated) | website = {{URL|geissens.de}} | food = Gucci rohlíky }} '''Robert Geiss''' (born January 29, 1964) is a German businessman and TV personality, best known for his show ''Die Geissens – Eine schrecklich glamouröse Familie'', in which he enjoys his luxurious lifestyle together with his family. He is married to Carmen Geiss. == Biography == === Early years and ''Uncle Sam''=== As a [[teenager]], Robert Geiss did not want to go to school because he thought that "if you want to make [[money]], you cannot sit at school every day". His father Reinhold Geiss offered him a job as a [[tradesman]] in his company, which Robert Geiss declined. He then went on holiday to [[Spain]], where he bought a pair of fitness trousers that he liked.{{cite news|title=Markus Lanz (vom 08. Mai 2013)|language=German|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g9PXhYsZksI|accessdate=10 April 2015}} When he returned to Cologne, Geiss decided to design similar clothing for German fitness studios and founded ''Uncle Sam'' in 1986. Having sold his inventory very quickly over the winter season, Geiss started buying shirts and pants for 10 [[Deutsche Mark|DM]] in [[Turkey]]. He then re-sold them for 49 DM in Germany. At the height of his success, Geiss employed 120 people. At some point, [[Kaufhof AG]] wanted to buy the firm, but Geiss declined because of legal reasons.{{cite news|title=Markus Lanz (vom 08. Mai 2013)|language=German|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QAeWLER6E4M|accessdate=10 April 2015}} In 1995 he finally sold his company for an undisclosed amount to an anonymous buyer and moved to Monaco with his wife Carmen.{{cite news|title=Robert Geiss Vermögen|language=German|url=http://www.vermoegen.org/robert-geiss-vermoegen/|accessdate=10 April 2015}} === Return to work and family === After ten years of partying and living the jet-set life, Geiss started to engage in buying, refurbishing and reselling luxury real estate.[http://www.bild.de/unterhaltung/tv/die-geissens/wie-reich-sind-sie-wirklich-36380434.bild.html Bild] Retrieved 6 June 2017.{{cite news|title=Die Geissens zu Gast bei Stefan Raab|language=German|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sruSARA0Tl8|accessdate=10 April 2015}} In 2004 his brother bought back ''Uncle Sam'' and became [[CEO]] of the company. Being friends with [[banker]]s in Monaco, Geiss also invested in the stock market. On May 30, 2003 his first daughter Davina Shakira was born, followed by his second daughter, Shania Tyra Maria on July 30, 2004.{{cite news|title=Die Geissens sind der Schrecken aller Millionäre.|language=German|url=https://www.welt.de/fernsehen/article109117192/Die-Geissens-sind-der-Schrecken-aller-Millionaere.html|accessdate=10 April 2015}} === Present: ''Die Geissens'' === Since January 2011 he is one of the main characters in the RTL2 TV series ''Die Geissens – Eine schrecklich glamouröse Familie'' alongside his family. In the beginning of March 2013 he started designing for his new label ''Roberto Geissini'', which became a popular fashion brand in Germany, [[Austria]], [[Switzerland]] and [[Luxembourg]].{{cite news|title=Geissens-Comeback! Das ist ihre neue Mode|language=German|url=http://www.merkur-online.de/aktuelles/boulevard/die-geissens-comeback-ihre-neue-mode-2781746.html|accessdate=10 April 2015}} In May 2015 he opened a small luxury resort on his property in [[Grimaud, Var|Grimaud]] near Saint Tropez.[http://www.mp-robertogeissini.eu/english/index.php Maison Prestige] Retrieved 6 June 2017.[http://www.express.de/news/willkommen-im--hotel-geissini--carmen-und-robert-geiss-eroeffnen-luxus-herberge-1009478 Express] (in German) Retrieved 6 June 2017. == Publications == *{{Citation|last1=Geiss|first1=R.|last2=Geiss|first2=C.|last3=Hock|first3=A.|lastauthoramp=yes|title=Von nix kommt nix: Voll auf Erfolgskurs mit den Geissens|publisher=Heyne|year=2013| isbn=978-3-453-68010-4}} == References == {{reflist}} == External links == * [http://top.de/stars/64J0-robert-geiss Robert Geiss] star profile at Top.de * {{IMDb name|4239051|Robert Geiss}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Geiss, Robert}} [[Category:1964 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:German businesspeople]]

{{multiple issues| {{BLP sources|date=December 2012}} {{notability|Biographies|date=December 2012}} {{peacock|date=December 2012}} {{BLP primary sources|date=December 2012}} {{Orphan|date=January 2013}} {{Like resume|date=June 2014}} }} '''Roberto Duailibi''' (born October 8, 1935 in [[Campo Grande, Brazil]]), is a Brazilian advertising executive. == Biography == Graduated in [[advertising]] from Escola de Propaganda de São Paulo in 1956, Roberto Duailibi became a publicist. He initiated his career in advertising in 1952, at the [[Colgate-Palmolive]] company. From 1956, he worked as copywriter in advertising agencies such as CIN - Companhia de Incremento de Negócios (now [[Leo Burnett]] Publicidade Ltda), JWT, McCann Ericson and Standard Propaganda, where he was Creative vice-president. In 1968, he joined José Zaragoza, Francesc Petit and Ronald Persichetti to create DPZ, one of the largest and most awarded advertising agencies in Brazil. He was awarded the "Advertiser of the Year" in 1969 in Prêmio Colunistas.
In addition to the recognition and awards as advertising executive, Roberto Duailibi is a writer and professor . He was professor and course director at ESPM of São Paulo and is currently dean in the Institution Council. He was also Creative professor at ECA - [[Escola de Comunicações e Artes]] of USP - Universidade de São Paulo.
For two periods, he was [[chairman]] at ABAP, the Brazilian Association of Advertising Agencies. He is advisor of Fundação Bienal de São Paulo, Fundo Social de Solidariedade of the São Paulo State Government and Chairman at FUNCEB - Fundação Cultural Exército Brasileiro. He wrote several books, among which is Criatividade & [[Marketing]], with Harry Simonsen Jr.. This book showed the concept of the heuristic ruler and the importance to follow methods encouraging creativity across the company’s departments. In addition to Criatividade & Marketing, he was very successful with his quote collections initially called Phrase Book. In 2005, he published Cartas a um Jovem Publicitário, a book directed to the young advertising professionals. In 2008, he published with Marina Pechlivanis the collection Idéias Poderosas, gathering thematic selections of [[quotation]]s in a pocket book. In the same year, he also launched the new edition of Criatividade & Marketing, with a digital version of the Heuristic Ruler. == Bibliography == *2008 Criatividade & Marketing , Roberto Duailibi & Harry Simonsen Jr. Editora M Books. *2008 Idéias Poderosas - Felicidade , Roberto Duailibi e Marina Pechlivanis. Editora Elsevier *2008 Idéias Poderosas - Inteligência , Roberto Duailibi e Marina Pechlivanis. Editora Elsevier *2008 Idéias Poderosas - Negócios, Roberto Duailibi e Marina Pechlivanis, Editora Elsevier *2005 Cartas a um jovem publicitário. Editora Campus *2005 Duailibi Essencial. Roberto Duailibi e Marina Pechlivanis, Editora Campus *2000 Duailibi das Citações. Editora Arx == References == *DUAILIBI, Roberto. Cartas a um jovem publicitário. Editora Campus, São Paulo, 2005. *DUAILIBI, Roberto & SIMONSEN JÚNIOR, Harry. Criatividade: a formulação de alternativas em marketing. São Paulo, Abril S/A, McGraw-Hill, 1971. *MCCARTHY, E. Jerome. Marketing. Rio de Janeiro, Campus, 1982. *BREZZO, R & COBRA, M. New Marketing. São Paulo, 2009. *KIRKPATRICK, Jerry. In defense of Advertising. Claremont, CA, 1997. == External links == *[http://www.dpz.com.br Website of the advertising agency with its history and icons of the Brazilian advertising] *[http://www.facasper.com.br/pp/site/historia/index.php Website of Faculdade Cásper Líbero with data on the Brazilian advertising history] *[http://www.fgv.br/cpdoc/historal/arq/Entrevista1293.pdf Interview to CPDOC/FGV] *[http://puc-riodigital.com.puc-rio.br/cgi/cgilua.exe/sys/start.htm?infoid=12115&sid=62&tpl=view_televisao.htm Interview to a Brazilian University - PUC ] *[http://www.portaldapropaganda.com.br/portal/entrevista-leia-mais-55/2586-virou-vo-agredir-o-espectador-critica-roberto-duailibi Interview to an advertising website] *[http://www2.anba.com.br/noticia_servicos.kmf?cod=10383487&indice=90 Brazil-Arab News Agency] {{DEFAULTSORT:Duailibi, Roberto}} [[Category:1935 births]] [[Category:Businesspeople in advertising]] [[Category:Brazilian businesspeople]] [[Category:Living people]] {{Brazil-business-bio-stub}}

Сергей Горьков | image = Горьков ВЭБ.jpg | alt = | caption = Gorkov in 2009 | birth_name = Sergei Nikolayevich Gorkov | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1968|12|1|df=y}} {{cite news|title=Сергей Горьков биография и карьера в Внешэкономбанк, последние новости и фото.|url=http://finparty.ru/personal/sergey-gorkov/|accessdate=31 May 2017|publisher=finparty.ru}} | birth_place = [[Gai, Orenburg Oblast]], [[Soviet Union|USSR]] | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = | other_names = | occupation = Banker; attorney | employer = [[Vnesheconombank]] (VEB) | children = 3 | spouse = Anna Gorkova | alma_mater = [[FSB Academy]] {{small|([[Bachelor of arts|BA]], 1994)}}
[[Plekhanov Russian University of Economics|Plekhanov University of Economics]] {{small|([[Master of science|MS]], 2002)}} | awards = [[Medal of the Order "For Merit to the Fatherland"]], II class
Certificate of Honor of Russia }} '''Sergei Nikolayevich Gorkov''' (also [[Romanization of Russian|tr.]] '''Sergey'''; {{lang-ru|Серге́й Никола́евич Горько́в}}; born 1 December 1968) is a Russian banker and attorney. Currently, he serves as chairman of [[Vnesheconombank]] (VEB), a major Russian state-owned bank. Previously, between 2010 and 2016, he was the deputy chairman of [[Sberbank]], Russia's largest bank.{{cite news | last1 = Becker | first1 = Jo | last2 = Rosenberg | first2 = Matthew | last3 = Haberman | first3 = Maggie | author-link1=Jo Becker | author-link2=Matthew Rosenberg | author-link3=Maggie Haberman | title = Senate Committee to Question Jared Kushner Over Meetings With Russians | url = https://www.nytimes.com/2017/03/27/us/politics/senate-jared-kushner-russia.html | newspaper = [[The New York Times]] | date = 27 March 2017 | accessdate =25 May 2017}} He is a graduate of the [[FSB Academy|Academy of the Federal Counter-Intelligence Service]], which prepares members for the [[Foreign Intelligence Service (Russia)|Foreign Intelligence Service]] and [[Federal Security Service]] (FSB), and holds a master's degree in economics. ==Early life and education== Gorkov was born in [[Gai, Orenburg Oblast]], [[Russian Soviet Federative Socialist Republic|Soviet Russia]], in 1968, to Nikolai Gorkov and Lyubov Gorkova. He has an older brother, Alexei Gorkov (born 1963), who joined the VEB board of directors in January 2017, and a younger sister, Antonina Konoplya (born 1971).{{cite news|title=Брат главы ВЭБа Сергея Горькова войдет в состав совета директоров ВЭБ-Лизинга|url=https://news.rambler.ru/politics/35877942-brat-glavy-veba-sergeya-gorkova-voydet-v-sostav-soveta-direktorov-veb-lizinga/|accessdate=26 May 2017|work=Rambler News|date=20 January 2017|language=ru-RU}} In 1994, Sergei graduated with a law degree from the [[FSB Academy|Academy of the Federal Counter-Intelligence Service]], which prepares members for the [[Foreign Intelligence Service (Russia)|Foreign Intelligence Service]] and [[Federal Security Service]] (FSB). In 2002, he earned a master's degree in economics at the [[Plekhanov Russian University of Economics]].{{cite news|title=About: Chairman|url=http://www.veb.ru/about/today/#chairman|accessdate=25 May 2017|work=www.veb.ru|publisher=[[Vnesheconombank]]}} He speaks English and Arabic.{{cite news|title=Горьков Сергей Николаевич — председатель Внешэкономбанка|url=http://orenpolit.ru/persons/item/1428-gorkov-sergej-nikolaevich-predsedatel-vneshekonombanka|accessdate=30 May 2017|work=Orenburgskaya Politika}} ==Career== ===Early career and Yukos=== [[File:Putin and Gorkov February 2017.jpg|thumb|left|250px|[[Vladimir Putin]] and Gorkov meet at the Kremlin, February 2017]] Gorkov later worked with [[Bank Menatep]] (1994–1997) before joining the [[Yukos]] oil company and Yukos Moscow (1997–2005), all of which are now defunct. He was a vice president at Yukos, where he oversaw personnel and pensions. He was also engaged in a social outreach program, Yukos' own youth movement called "New Civilization" ({{lang-ru|«Новая Цивилизация»}}). The movement, which was extremely costly, had a mission to change Russia, and involved summer camps and young people engaging in the political system with their own party and parliament.{{cite news|last1=Rudenko|first1=Pyotr|title="У него все хорошо при нынешнем режиме": кто такой Сергей Горьков|url=http://www.forbes.ru/finansy/igroki/313415-u-nego-vse-khorosho-pri-nyneshnem-rezhime-kto-takoi-sergei-gorkov|accessdate=25 May 2017|work=[[Forbes|Forbes Russia]]|date=26 February 2017|language=ru}} In 2003, Yukos began to collapse under a massive tax scandal amid [[Yukos shareholders vs. Russia|lawsuits against the Russian government]]. ''[[Forbes]]'' stated it was a large mystery how Gorkov managed to avoid arrest, but inside sources (including [[Pavel Ivlev]]) stated it was through his connections with the Kremlin and the [[Federal Security Service|FSB]].{{cite news|last1=Luhn|first1=Alec|title=Who is Sergei Gorkov, the powerful Russian banker who met Jared Kushner?|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2017/jun/03/sergei-gorkov-russian-banker-jared-kushner|accessdate=3 June 2017|work=[[The Guardian]]|date=3 June 2017}} Yukos CEO [[Mikhail Khodorkovsky]], an enemy of Russian leader [[Vladimir Putin]], was imprisoned for eight years for fraud and tax evasion, a conviction that drew skepticism in the West. Gorkov's subordinate, Alexei Kurtsin, was sentenced to 15 years in prison for embezzlement and served eight.{{cite news|last1=Sharkov|first1=Damien|title=Who is Sergey Gorkov, the Russian banker Jared Kushner allegedly met?|url=http://www.newsweek.com/sergey-gorkov-grad-russian-banker-kushner-617422|accessdate=31 May 2017|work=[[Newsweek]]|date=30 May 2017|language=en}} In 2005, after the Yukos fiasco, Gorkov moved to [[London]], where he worked with several companies. He sat on the board of directors for Eton Energy Ltd. and for liquor company New Muscovy Company Ltd. Gorkov returned to Russia in 2006. From 2005 to 2008, he sat on the board of directors of [[FESCO Transport Group]], Russia's largest intermodal transport operator. ===Sberbank=== Gorkov moved into the banking sector in November 2008, when he joined the state-owned [[Sberbank of Russia|Sberbank]] as director of personnel. During the recession, Gorkov oversaw an overhaul of the workforce, reducing the number of employees from 270,000 to 240,000 to increase efficiency and profit.{{cite news|title=Горьков Сергей Николаевич|url=http://www.kommersant.ru/doc/2925502|accessdate=31 May 2017|work=Kommersant|date=26 February 2016}} He also led a retraining program, with 200,000 of the employees receiving some form of retraining, and introduced an employee evaluation system that led to monthly bonuses for the best employees.{{cite news|last1=Chaikina|first1=Yulia|title=Сбербанк: реформ невпроворот|url=http://www.forbes.ru/karera/menedzhment/53487-sberbank-reform-nevprovorot|accessdate=31 May 2017|work=[[Forbes]]|date=27 July 2010|language=ru}} Gorkov was tremendously successful during his first five years at Sberbank; Gorkov was appointed deputy chairman of the board of Sberbank in October 2010. He was promoted to run its international operations division and helped it expand its business reach from two countries to 20. Its international expansion included acquisitions of Volksbank of Austria and [[DenizBank]] of Turkey. Starting in October 2012, Gorkov was chairman of Sberbank's division in [[Kazakhstan]]. ===VEB=== In February 2016, Russian President [[Vladimir Putin]] promoted Gorkov to chairman of [[Vnesheconombank]] (VEB), succeeding [[Vladimir Dmitriev]].{{cite news|title=Путин назначил Сергея Горькова главой ВЭБ|url=http://tass.ru/ekonomika/2697259|accessdate=25 May 2017|work=ТАСС|date=26 February 2017|language=ru}} According to Russian sources, Gorkov's connection to the FSB played a part in his appointment to lead VEB; Putin, the former director of the FSB, has appointed several of its members to important roles in Russian government. Founded in 1922, Vnesheconombank is one of the oldest banks in Russia, but was acquired as a state development bank in 2007. During the [[Financial crisis of 2007–2008|financial crisis of 2007–08]], Vnesheconombank's status as a state-owned bank forced it to assist the government with the domestic economy. It reorganized struggling banks, purchased two steel companies, bought 175 billion rubles (approximately $3 billion) of sagging shares of Russian companies to keep them afloat, and also heavily invested in struggling [[Banking in Ukraine|Ukrainian banks]].{{cite news|last1=Tkachev|first1=Ivan|last2=Polyakova|first2=Yulia|title=Проблема в $20 млрд: как Банк развития превратился в черную дыру|url=http://www.rbc.ru/finances/18/02/2016/56c4a49a9a79475ba1d428f9|accessdate=30 May 2017|publisher=RBC|date=18 February 2016|language=ru}} VEB, which has been dubbed Vladimir Putin's "pet bank" and "slush fund" by Western observers, also lent significantly for the [[2014 Winter Olympics]] in [[Sochi]], covertly funded pro-Russian groups in Ukraine, and has frequently bailed out [[Russian oligarch]]s close to Putin.{{cite news|last1=Mazzetti|first1=Matthew|last2=Rosenberg|first2=Mark|last3=Haberman|first3=Maggie|title=Investigation Turns to Kushner’s Motives in Meeting With a Putin Ally|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/05/29/us/politics/jared-kushner-russia-investigation.html|accessdate=30 May 2017|work=The New York Times|date=29 May 2017}} According to ''[[Foreign Policy]]''{{'}}s assessment, VEB "functions as an off-the-books kitty that allows President Vladimir Putin to reward his allies and shower money on his pet projects and political priorities."{{cite news|last1=Groll|first1=Elias|title=Why Is Putin's 'Private Slush Fund' Courting Jared Kushner?|url=https://foreignpolicy.com/2017/04/07/why-is-putins-private-slush-fund-courting-jared-kushner/|accessdate=30 May 2017|work=[[Foreign Policy]]|date=7 April 2017}} When Gorkov arrived in 2012, VEB was struggling to stay afloat; it reportedly needed 1.3 trillion rubles (approximately $22.8 billion) by 2020 to avoid defaulting on its debt.{{cite news|last1=Solodkov|first1=Vasily|title=Что не так с ВЭБом: почему, несмотря на господдержку, он убыточен|url=http://www.forbes.ru/biznes/335495-chto-ne-tak-s-vebom-pochemu-nesmotrya-na-gospodderzhku-po-prezhnemu-ubytochen|accessdate=26 May 2017|work=[[Forbes]]|date=19 December 2016|language=ru}} In 2015, the bank received a $20 billion bailout{{cite news|last1=Weiss|first1=Michael|title=Jared Kushner Tempted by Russia's Bank of Spies|url=http://www.thedailybeast.com/articles/2017/03/28/jared-kushner-tempted-by-russia-s-bank-of-spies|accessdate=26 May 2017|work=[[The Daily Beast]]|date=30 January 2017}} following approval of [[Ministry of Finance (Russia)|Minister of Finance]] [[Anton Siluanov]]. In July 2014, Vnesheconombank was [[International sanctions during the Ukrainian crisis|slapped with sanctions]] by the European Union and the United States over the [[Russian military intervention in Ukraine (2014–present)|Russian invasion of Ukraine]]; however, Gorkov has said that the bank is aggressively pursuing business in China.{{cite news|title=«Проектов больше, чем денег»: глава ВЭБа Сергей Горьков о китайских кредитах в 2017 году|url=https://russian.rt.com/business/article/353245-veb-kredit-kitai|accessdate=25 May 2017|publisher=RT|date=25 January 2017|language=ru-RU}} The bank is also pursuing deals in the [[Persian Gulf]] and Islamic world. In 2016, Gorkov announced VEB would partner with the [[Islamic Development Bank]] in [[Saudi Arabia]], a financing conglomerate of 56 Islamic countries,{{cite news|title=Три основных направления стратегии ВЭБа|url=http://www.vestifinance.ru/articles/73171|accessdate=30 May 2017|work=Vesti Finance|date=21 July 2016|language=ru}}{{cite news|title=Russia’s VEB planning first deals with Islamic Development Bank|url=http://tass.com/economy/877158|accessdate=30 May 2017|agency=TASS|date=20 May 2016|language=ru}} with an initial pilot project of $100 million.{{cite news|title=Russia’s VEB considers $100 mln pilot deal with Islamic Development Bank|url=http://tass.com/economy/893641|accessdate=30 May 2017|agency=TASS|date=10 August 2016|language=ru}} ===Meeting with Jared Kushner=== In 2017, Gorkov drew significant attention in Western media over his December 2016 meeting with [[Jared Kushner]], son-in-law and top adviser to then president-elect [[Donald Trump]]. In March 2017, [[White House Press Secretary]] [[Sean Spicer]] stated that Kushner met with Gorkov briefly as part of his role in the transition and as a diplomatic conduit to the [[United States Department of State|State Department]].{{cite news|last1=Pavia|first1=Will|title=Kushner's Kremlin connection focus|url=http://www.theaustralian.com.au/news/world/the-times/jared-kushner-named-as-person-of-interest-in-russia-probe/news-story/bd81a5a645f7138c6ad8f30fbffe5d80|accessdate=26 May 2017|work=The Australian|date=25 May 2017}} However, VEB issued a statement that said Gorkov met with Kushner on a private matter concerning his family's real estate corporation, [[Kushner Companies]], even though VEB has been under [[International sanctions during the Ukrainian crisis#Third|international sanctions since July 2014]].{{cite news|last1=Dilanian|first1=Ken|last2=Alexander|first2=Peter|last3=Kube|first3=Courtney|title=Jared Kushner under FBI scrutiny in Russia probe, say officials|url=http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/jared-kushner-now-under-fbi-scrutiny-russia-probe-say-officials-n764826|accessdate=26 May 2017|publisher=NBC News|date=25 May 2017|language=en}} The statement, issued to [[Reuters]], said that Gorkov met "with a number of representatives of the largest banks and business establishments of the United States, including Jared Kushner, the head of Kushner Companies." According to multiple reports, Kushner is looking for investors in his project at [[666 Fifth Avenue]], which Kushner Companies bought for a record $1.8 billion in January 2007 prior to the recession.{{cite news|last1=Frank|first1=Thomas|last2=Cohen|first2=Marshall|title=Russian banker who met Kushner has Putin ties|url=http://www.cnn.com/2017/03/27/politics/kushner-meeting-russian-banker-tied-to-putin/|accessdate=26 May 2017|publisher=CNN|date=28 March 2017}}{{cite news|last1=Dilanian|first1=Ken|last2=Caldwell|first2=Leigh Ann|last3=Siemaszko|first3=Corky|title=Was Kushner seeking a Russian bailout for his Manhattan building? Congress will ask|url=http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/was-kushner-seeking-russian-bailout-manhattan-building-congress-will-ask-n766801|accessdate=5 June 2017|publisher=[[NBC News]]|date=5 June 2017|language=en}} VEB and White House officials have declined to specify the date of Gorkov's meeting with Kushner. According to ''The Washington Post'', a VEB private jet associated with Gorkov's travel flew from Moscow to [[Newark, New Jersey]] on 13 December, and then departed 14 December to fly to Japan, where Putin was visiting for two days.{{cite news|last1=Filipov|first1=David|last2=Brittain|first2=Amy|last3=Helderman|first3=Rosalind S.|last4=Hamburger|first4=Tom|title=Explanations for Kushner’s meeting with head of Kremlin-linked bank don't match up|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/explanations-for-kushners-meeting-with-head-of-kremlin-linked-bank-dont-match-up/2017/06/01/dd1bdbb0-460a-11e7-bcde-624ad94170ab_story.html|accessdate=2 June 2017|work=[[The Washington Post]]|date=1 June 2017}}{{cite news|last1=Rubin|first1=Jennifer|title=Donald Trump's Russia problems are getting worse|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/blogs/right-turn/wp/2017/06/02/trumps-russia-problems-are-getting-worse/|accessdate=5 June 2017|work=The Washington Post|date=2 June 2017}} On 25 May 2017, it was reported that Kushner was being investigated for his meetings with Gorkov and Russian ambassador to the United States [[Sergey Kislyak]], meetings which Kushner omitted on his form about foreign contacts when applying for security clearance.{{cite news|last1=Zapotosky|first1=Matt|last2=Horwitz|first2=Sari|last3=Barrett|first3=Devlin|last4=Entous|first4=Adam|title=Jared Kushner now a focus in Russia investigation|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/national-security/jared-kushner-now-a-focus-in-russia-investigation/2017/05/25/f078db74-40c7-11e7-8c25-44d09ff5a4a8_story.html|accessdate=26 May 2017|work=The Washington Post|date=25 May 2017}} Gorkov's status as an FSB alumnus has led to media scrutiny of his past, especially as VEB acted as a cover for convicted Russian spy [[Evgeny Buryakov|Yevgeny Buryakov]], who was deported from the U.S. in March after serving 30 months in federal prison. [[CNN]] also noted that when Donald Trump brought the [[Miss Universe]] Pageant to Moscow in [[Miss Universe 2013|2013]], its biggest sponsor was Sberbank, led by Gorkov at the time.{{cite news|last=Griffin|first=Drew|authorlink=Drew Griffin|title=Who is the Russian banker who met with Kushner?|url=http://www.cnn.com/videos/tv/2017/05/31/russian-banker-sergey-gorkov-jared-kushner-the-lead-drew-griffin.cnn|accessdate=31 May 2017|publisher=[[CNN]]|date=31 May 2017}} ===Additional roles=== Gorkov also sits on the board of directors for several companies, including Sberbank and Denizbank, the Russian aircraft industry's [[United Aircraft Corporation]], and the Agency for Strategic Initiatives, a state-run project that encourages young Russians to turn their ideas into businesses.{{cite news|title=Глава Внешэкономбанка Сергей Горьков вошел в совет директоров ОАК|url=https://rns.online/transport/Glava-Vneshekonombanka-Sergei-Gorkov-voshel-v-sovet-direktorov-OaK--2016-06-28/|accessdate=31 May 2017|agency= [[Rambler (portal)|Rambler]]|date=28 June 2016|language=ru-ru}}{{cite news|title=Sergey Gorkov, Vnesheconombank: Profile & Biography|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/profiles/people/17218174-sergey-n-gorkov|accessdate=31 May 2017|publisher=Bloomberg}} ==Personal life== Little is known about Gorkov's private life. Gorkov is married to Anna Nikolayevna Gorkova, with whom he has sons Alexei (born 1997) and Nikolai (born 2006), and a daughter, Polina (born 2002). He lists his hobbies as [[cartography]] and history. Gorkov was awarded the [[Medal of the Order "For Merit to the Fatherland"]], II class, and the [[Certificate of Honor of Russia]]. == References == {{Reflist|30em}} == External links == {{commons category|Sergey Gorkov|Sergei Gorkov}} *{{en icon}} [http://www.veb.ru/about/today/ Biography at VEB.ru] *{{en icon}} [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EiMTDLazglc Interview about Sberbank] with [[INSEAD]] (August 2012) *{{ru icon}} [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HHcIzYRTkyc Interview about VEB] on [[Russia-24]] (July 2016) *{{ru icon}} [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ace1BpfRZNk Economics lecture by Gorkov] (December 2016) {{DEFAULTSORT:Gorkov, Sergei}} [[Category:1968 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Russian businesspeople]] [[Category:Russian bankers]] [[Category:People from Gai, Orenburg Oblast]] [[Category:Russian lawyers]] [[Category:FSB Academy alumni]] [[Category:Plekhanov Russian University of Economics alumni]] [[Category:Recipients of the Medal of the Order "For Merit to the Fatherland" II class]] [[Category:Russians associated with interference in the 2016 United States elections]]

Chua Siew Lim Neo (mother) | relatives = | signature = | website = | footnotes = }} {{Chinese name|[[Tan (surname)|Tan]]}} '''Tan Chay Yan''' ({{zh|c=陳齊賢|p=Chén Qíxián}}; 1870 - 6 March 1916) was a rubber plantation merchant and [[philanthropist]]. A [[Peranakan]], Tan is the grandson of philanthropist [[Tan Tock Seng]] by his father, [[Tan Teck Guan]].{{cite book|author=Leo Suryadinata|title=Southeast Asian Personalities of Chinese Descent: A Biographical Dictionary, Volume I & II|year=2012|publisher=Institute of Southeast Asian Studies|isbn=981-4345-21-0}} Tan was noted in [[Malayan history]] as the first man to plant rubber on a commercial basis, after he was introduced to rubber planting by [[Henry Nicholas Ridley]]. Subsequently, Tan started a {{convert|22|acre|m2|sing=on}} rubber estate at Bukit Lintang. He then ventured his rubber plantation business into [[Sri Lanka]]. According to his family, Tan's rubber plantation still belonged to the family. As a philanthropist, Tan also gave [[Straits dollar|$]]15,000 towards the setting up of a medical college in Singapore. The donation went towards the construction of the [[Tan Teck Guan Building]], which Tan named in memory of his late father. Tan also served as a Municipal Councillor and a Trustee of the [[Cheng Hoon Teng]] Temple. There is a variety of orchid named Vanda Tan Chay Yan, according to one of the Peranakan Cina Melaka's annual dinner souvenir books, but there is no record of who named it such. The Vanda Tan Chay Yan was named by his son [[Robert Tan Hoon Siang]] who personally developed the hybrid. A road in Melaka was also named after him in view of his contributions to the country's revenue. Tan died of malaria at the age of 46. A relative believed he could have caught it as he often spent the long hours spent at the rubber plantations. Tan left behind his wife, Chua Wan Neo, a tenth generation Nyonya, six daughters and a son. For memorizing his contributions, there is a road called ''Chay Yan Street'' as named after him in [[Tiong Bahru]], [[Singapore]]. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.tourism-melaka.com/melaka/TanChayYan.html Newspaper article] {{DEFAULTSORT:Tan, Chay Yan}} [[Category:Malaysian businesspeople]] [[Category:Malaysian philanthropists]] [[Category:Deaths from malaria]] [[Category:Malaysian people of Peranakan descent]] [[Category:1870 births]] [[Category:1916 deaths]]

'''Theodore P. Angelopoulos''' (born 1943) is a Greek shipping and steel magnate.
==Early life== Theodore Angelopoulos was born in Athens, and lived in Switzerland for many years, where he received a BSc in Business Administration from the [[University of Zurich]]. His family were pioneers in the Greek steel industry and began dealing in the dry cargo sector of the shipping industry in the early 1950s.<ref name="greeknewsonline1">{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.greeknewsonline.com/gianna-and-theodore-angelopoulos-to-receive-lead100-award-for-excellence/ |title=Gianna and Theodore Angelopoulos to Receive Lead100 Award for Excellence | Greek News |publisher=Greeknewsonline.com |date=2011-03-29 |accessdate=2015-10-06}}</ref>
==Career== Angelopoulos built an internationally based group of companies with interests in shipping and steel, and with investments in real estate and private equities, as well as other financial entities worldwide.{{citation needed|date=March 2015}}
In 1996, he established Metrostar Management in Athens, and entered the oil tanker market in the same year, with his company going on to become one of the world's leading oil tanker operators. In 2002, he took control of the Dutch shipbuilding company oceAnco and he re-established it as a leading shipbuilder of custom-built luxury mega-yachts.<ref name="greeknewsonline1"/>
==Personal life== Angelopoulos is married to [[Gianna Angelopoulos-Daskalaki]].<ref name="greeknewsonline1"/>
His two nephews, [[Panagiotis Angelopoulos]] and [[Giorgos Angelopoulos]] are also in shipping, and steel.
In 1990, Angelopoulos bought the [[56 Old Church Street|Old Rectory]] in Chelsea, for some years London's largest and most expensive residential property, and probably the first in London to sell for more than £10 million.<ref>{{cite web|author1=Julia Kollewe |author2=Rupert Neate |url=https://www.theguardian.com/uk/2012/jun/01/london-property-stable-investment-europeans |title=London property offers stable investment for wealthy Europeans | UK news |publisher=The Guardian |date= |accessdate=2015-10-06}}</ref>
In 2007, he had the 82 metre yacht Alfa Nero built. In 2011, Alfa Nero was up for sale with an asking price of US$115 million, and it was bought by the Russian billionaire [[Andrey Guryev]].<ref name="superyachtfan1">{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.superyachtfan.com/superyacht/superyacht_alfa_nero.html |title=SuperYacht Alfa Nero - Andrey Guryev - PhosAgro |publisher=Superyachtfan.com |date= |accessdate=2015-10-06}}</ref>
As of 2014, he owns a new 66 metre yacht, called ''Okto''.<ref name="autogenerated1"/><ref name="superyachtfan1"/>

'''Vicente Cuadra Chamberlain''' (1919–2000) was one of the pioneers of the [[Nicaragua]]n [[advertising agency|advertising industry]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Fallece pionero del ingenio publicitario|author=|url=http://archivo.laprensa.com.ni/archivo/2000/noviembre/15/nacionales/nacionales-20001115-20.html|newspaper=La Perensa|first=Valeria|last=González|date=15 November 2000|accessdate=February 4, 2012|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120607114722/http://archivo.laprensa.com.ni/archivo/2000/noviembre/15/nacionales/nacionales-20001115-20.html|archive-date=7 June 2012|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
He was the eldest son of the economist, [[Vicente Cuadra Gomez]] and a grandson of [[José Vicente Cuadra|President Vicente Cuadra Lugo]]. After his graduation from ''Collegio Centro America'' in 1939, Vicente came to San Francisco, California, to study business. He worked as an office manager during the 1940s and early 1950s.
In 1956, he returned to Managua, Nicaragua, to work as the general manager of the advertising agency, Publicidad Cuadra Chamberlain. His brother, [[Raul Cuadra Chamberlain|Raul]] founded the agency in 1950. During the next forty years, under Vicente's innovative and creative leadership, the agency prospered to become the undisputed leader{{Citation needed|date=February 2012}} in the advertising/communications industry in the country and one of the best in Latin America.

{{Unreferenced|date=December 2006}} {{Expand Czech|Václav Klement|date=June 2015}} {{Expand German|Václav Klement|date=December 2009}} [[File:Václav Klement.jpg|thumb|Václav Klement]]
'''Václav Klement''' (October 16, 1868, [[Velvary]] – August 10, 1938, [[Mladá Boleslav]]) was a [[Czech Republic|Czech]] [[Automobile|automotive]] pioneer, co-founder of [[Laurin & Klement]], what is now [[Škoda Auto]]. He was a bookseller originally.
His childhood was not the happiest one. His mother died when he was small, replaced by a stepmother who hardly paid any attention to the little boy. From the age of 14 Klement did manual jobs although he showed talent for studying. Despite the obstacles he managed to become a good student and became an apprentice in a bookshop in the town of Slaný where he managed to finish his secondary studies.
After that Klement worked in Prague for some time and then moved to [[Mladá Boleslav]] where he worked in another bookshop. When the owner of the bookshop died Klement decided to buy it. However the business did not prosper and Klement had to sell the bookshop to pay off his debts.
The story of founding the Laurin & Klement Company starts with the day when Klement bought a bicycle made by the German company [[Seidel & Naumann]]. Upon finding a problem with the bicycle Klement sent a letter in the Czech language to the company, requesting repair. The company replied that they would deal with the request only if the letter were written in a "comprehensible" language. Klement was so indignant that he decided together with [[Václav Laurin]], to start repairing bicycles themselves.
Later in 1895, propelled by Klement's modesty, excellent people skills and business acumen, together with Laurin's technical expertise, the two decided to found the Laurin & Klement Company, producing their own bicycles. These were known as Slavia bicycles. The company took off, and soon had 12 employees, later going up to 40.
In 1899 they went on to produce motorcycles which were an immediate success not only at home but also abroad, even in sport competitions. In 1902 Laurin & Klement motorcycles were successful in the famous Paris - Vienna race. This race covered 1430 km and the only motorcycles that made it to the finish line without any breakdowns in 31 hours were the Laurin & Klement motorcycles.
Soon these motorcycles became so successful that the company decided to stop bicycle production in order to devote itself fully to motorcycles. In 1903 the company had already about 200 employees producing around 2000 motorcycles annually.
In 1905 the company started making cars and in 1907 it expanded, registered on the stock exchange, and stopped motorcycle production. In 1925 the Laurin & Klement Company joined the Pilsner Škoda Concern and the name of the factory was changed to Laurin & Klement - Škoda, later only Škoda which produced hugely successful automobiles and became one of the great brand names, recognized worldwide, in the history of the Czech Republic. Václav Laurin kept the position of technical director. In 1991 the Škoda Factory became a member of the Volkswagen Group.
